We came here for a tapas dinner one night after visiting the Picasso Museum nearby. I have to agree that the prices are bit high for tapas but the quality of food is makes up for it.  We waited a while before our waitress to our table since they were short staffed before the peak dinner hour.  We ordered 4 tapas with the Catalan tomato bread.  The tuna was my favorite by far!  I loved the soy sauce dressing and the black sesame.  The ham croquettes were mostly potato with only bits of ham.  The tomato bread didn't only had specks of tomato on there compared to what we had the night before.  We mistakenly got the chicken nuggets instead of shrimp, but we did get the shrimp at the end.  The Camembert cheese was really delicious! The wine was very good as expected.  Overall, the food here was just OK...nothing to rave about.  The service could be more attentive as opposed to feeling rushed. You may want to choose another place if you're looking for authentic Spanish tapas.
